results.title: ‘Knock at the Cabin’ Review: Who’s There? The Apocalypse.
results.abstract: In M. Night Shyamalan’s latest thought experiment, Dave Bautista brings the end of the world to a peaceful country cottage.

results.title: ‘80 for Brady’ Review: Remember These Titans
results.abstract: This stubbornly charming romp starring Lily Tomlin, Jane Fonda, Sally Field and Rita Moreno is inspired by the story of a real group of female friends with a love for Tom Brady and the New England Patriots.

results.title: ‘Dionne Warwick: Don’t Make Me Over’ Review: A Trailblazer Gets Her Flowers
results.abstract: This documentary tries to do justice to a six-decade career in 95 minutes, which proves challenging.
des_facet: Dionne Warwick: Don't Make Me Over (Movie)

results.title: ‘Pathaan’ Review: Fighting the Good (and Long) Fight
results.abstract: Filled to the brim with action set pieces, “Pathaan” stars Shah Rukh Khan as a secret agent saving India from havoc unleashed by a vengeful former operative.

results.title: Which Sundance Movies Could Follow ‘CODA’ to the Oscars?
results.abstract: Jonathan Majors in “Magazine Dreams” and Teyana Taylor in “A Thousand and One,” among others, could make the journey from Park City to the Dolby Theater.

results.abstract: This month’s picks look at an organized-labor fight, a student impostor and a lecturer chronicling racism in America.

results.title: Academy Won’t Rescind Best Actress Nomination
results.abstract: The organization investigated whether an Oscars campaign for the “To Leslie” actress Andrea Riseborough had violated rules.
org_facet: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences

multimedia.caption: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences did say it discovered “social media and outreach campaigning tactics” on behalf of Andrea Riseborough that “caused concern.”
The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences did say it discovered “social media and outreach campaigning tactics” on behalf of Andrea Riseborough that “caused concern.”

results.title: Superman in Starring Role as DC Studios Unveils Strategy
results.abstract: The yet-to-be-cast “Superman: Legacy” will begin a story that unfolds across at least 10 interconnected movies and TV shows, with Batman, Swamp Thing and others.

multimedia.caption: James Gunn, left, and Peter Safran are the chief executives of DC Studios, a new Warner Bros. division dedicated to superhero content.

results.title: More Than Shirley: Cindy Williams’s 6 Best Moments Onscreen
results.abstract: Her comedic work in “Laverne & Shirley” was career-defining. But the actress had other chops, too. Here’s a look at some of her best work and where to see it.

multimedia.caption: Cindy Williams, right (with Penny Marshall), was best known for her role as Shirley Feeney, an unmarried blue-collar worker in Milwaukee, in “Laverne & Shirley.”

results.title: ‘Full Time’ Review: No Rest for the Working Girl
results.abstract: A breathlessly tense portrait of modern labor, this French drama stars Laure Calamy as a single mother who hits her breaking point during a nationwide strike.

results.title: ‘Body Parts’ Review: Even Sex Scenes Have Rules
results.abstract: The documentary features performers and filmmakers discussing onscreen nudity and sex, but offers little on the subject of sexual exploitation.

multimedia.caption: In “Body Parts,” interview subjects discuss nudity riders, contractual documents that specify what acts an actor is willing to perform.
In “Body Parts,” interview subjects discuss nudity riders, contractual documents that specify what acts an actor is willing to perform.

results.title: ‘Love in the Time of Fentanyl’ Review: Heartbreak, Death and Hope in Vancouver
results.abstract: To combat the overdose crisis, a group that includes former and current users open a safe consumption site where shooting up does not have to mean death.
des_facet: Love in the Time of Fentanyl (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Drug users can safely consume their drugs at the Overdose Prevention Society, in Vancouver, where drugs are tested for fentanyl. They talk openly about what led them to start using, and about the challenges of quitting.

Drug users can safely consume their drugs at the Overdose Prevention Society, in Vancouver, where drugs are tested for fentanyl. They talk openly about what led them to start using, and about the challenges of quitting.

results.title: ‘A Lot of Nothing’ Review: The Cop Next Door

results.title: Kerry Condon: ‘I Don’t Think Anything Has Ever Come Easy to Me’
results.abstract: An ardent animal lover, the supporting actress Oscar nominee for “The Banshees of Inisherin” channeled grief from her dog’s death into her performance.

multimedia.caption: Kerry Condon described the nomination as “a dream come true.” She said, “I don’t think there’s anything wrong with admitting that you’re ambitious.”

results.title: Oscar Isaac, Rachel Brosnahan and the Draw of a Neglected Hansberry Play
results.abstract: The first major New York revival of “The Sign in Sidney Brustein’s Window,” Lorraine Hansberry’s 1964 Broadway play, comes to BAM this month. What took so long?
des_facet: The Sign in Sidney Brustein's Window (Play)

multimedia.caption: “We are revisiting a huge conversation right now about white apathy and the consequences of that in our political system and world,” Rachel Brosnahan said. Lorraine Hansberry “explores that with such nuance in this play.”
multimedia.copyright: Erik Tanner for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “We are revisiting a huge conversation right now about white apathy and the consequences of that in our political system and world,” Rachel Brosnahan said. Lorraine Hansberry “explores that with such nuance in this play.”

results.title: Gregory Allen Howard, Screenwriter of ‘Remember the Titans,’ Dies at 70

results.title: Sylvia Syms, Versatile British Actress, Is Dead at 89
results.abstract: In a career that began in the 1950s, she had roles that ranged from the lead in the movie “Teenage Bad Girl” to Margaret Thatcher and the Queen Mother.

results.title: The Responsibility of Watching
results.abstract: The video of Memphis police beating Tyre Nichols challenges public complacency — and complicity. What are our duties as citizens and as human beings?

multimedia.caption: An image from the body-cam video of the Memphis police beating Tyre Nichols. In viewing the footage, an ethical line separates witness from spectatorship.
multimedia.copyright: Memphis Police Department, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.title: ‘Infinity Pool’ and the Battle for an R Rating
results.abstract: The story of how an extreme horror movie with an orgy scene fought off an NC-17 label involves a film-board whisperer, minuscule cuts and talk of a new rating.

results.title: Once a Bullied Teen, Now the Movies’ Master Storyteller of Youth
results.abstract: At 31, Lukas Dhont already has two art-house hits to his name. The Belgian director’s latest film, “Close,” shows his skill at eliciting intense performances from young actors.

results.title: Mia Hansen-Love and the Hazy Line Where Real Life Ends and Art Begins
results.abstract: The French director translates her experiences into critically lauded dramas like “One Fine Morning,” about her father’s death and her own new love.
